content.description: Fun start with slanting feet.  Pumpy, but only if you ignore the two lie down rests.

Begin on vertical terrain up to a jug at the second bolt.  Leave the jug through some techy climbing up to a roof.  Pull the roof through sustained movement into moderate face climbing.  Finish out 2 small roofs with tricky and interesting body positioning.
content.location: Middle of the main wall, at the top of the steepest part of the hill.  Route right of the wet streak.

content.description: Straightforward and fun climbing for the first 15 feet leads to a funky bulge mantle into a hueco.  Step up to the roof and don't stop fondling until you find the biggest holds you can to pull to the chains.
content.location: Left most route of the three route moderate zone.  Second wall of routes from the upper access trail to the main wall.

content.description: Tricky second bolt climbing leads to excellent flowy climbing on big holds on decievingly steep terrain.
content.location: At the top of the hill above the 5.11 section of the main wall.

content.description: Begin on easy climbing through the second bolt where the wall bulges out a little.  Continue up towards the big roof on holds that are never quite as good as you'd like.
content.location: At the crest of the steep part of the main wall.

content.description: Technical face climbing to fun roof pulling.  Great for the grade
content.location: Far climber's right of the main wall at Ben's Branch.  It is the Middle of three routes on the Easy wall

content.description: Right most right on the 5.9 wall.  Face climbing leads to a buldge at the finish.  High stick clip from the right side.

Begin with bouldery start over a small bulge into the big Hueco at the third bolt.  Get a shake and continue through sustained movement until the 5th bolt where the climbing mellows out for a bit until the double roofs and sneaky sloper finish.
content.location: Middle of the wall on the more verticle section.  Look for the big hueco about 20 feet up.

content.description: A trickier start leads to better holds and finally to a roof.  Find the undercling and lean back onto some jugs to clip the chains
content.location: Furthest right section of rock at Ben's Branch Main cliff.  From the upper approach trail this is the first piece of rock you'll come to.  America's Most Wanted is the left of two routes on this face.

content.description: Fun bouldery start leads into sustained 5.10 climbing for the first half of the route.  Find a rest at the ledge before entering the crux dihedral, a long move gets you beneath a bulge with a slightly awkward work-around.  Finish on 5.8 fun.

Begin with a long looking, but surprisingly manageable first move off of a good horn.  Move through edgy climbing to a ledge.  Climb a techy face through the hollows feature and then finish on great big fun holds.
content.location: Up hill on the main cliff.  Has two "fossil" looking features near the first bolt.  Just left of UMWA

content.description: Thoughtful start leads to bigger holds on the face.  Finally enjoy swimming in the most fantastic jug ruffles in the region.
content.location: Furthest right route on the furthest right wall.  The first wall you come to from the upper approach trail.

content.description: Begin on techy face climbing up to good flowing moves through the middle.  Grab a shake and then move up and right through the final committing roof.
Techy face climbing leads to a powerful and dynamic roof pull.  Finish on much easier climbing.
content.location: Middle of the 5.11 section.  First route right of the the hueco of "full circle"

content.description: This is a roadside crag with access newly acquired by the Central Appalachia Climbers Coalition.  It is still brand new and under development.  Town rules to come soon.  If you go up there please DO NOT block the road as the town needs access to the water plant above.  Check back for more info soon.
